00065 /*****************************************************************************\
00066  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00067  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00068  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00069  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00070  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00071  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00072  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00073 \*****************************************************************************/
00074 
00075 /*===========================================================================
00076  *==========================================================================*/
00077 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00078 #include <config.h>
00079 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>
00080 #include "m_spec.h"
00081 #include "m_sh.h"
00082 
00083 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00084 #define M_SH_SIZE_VOID          0
00085 #define M_SH_SIZE_BIT           1
00086 #define M_SH_SIZE_CHAR          8
00087 #define M_SH_SIZE_SHORT         16
00088 #define M_SH_SIZE_INT           32
00089 #define M_SH_SIZE_LONG          32
00090 #define M_SH_SIZE_FLOAT         32
00091 #define M_SH_SIZE_DOUBLE        64
00092 #define M_SH_SIZE_POINTER       32
00093 #define M_SH_SIZE_UNION         -1
00094 #define M_SH_SIZE_STRUCT        -1
00095 #define M_SH_SIZE_BLOCK         -1
00096 #define M_SH_SIZE_MAX           64
00097 
00098 #define M_SH_ALIGN_VOID         -1
00099 #define M_SH_ALIGN_BIT          1
00100 #define M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR         8
00101 #define M_SH_ALIGN_SHORT        16
00102 #define M_SH_ALIGN_INT          32
00103 #define M_SH_ALIGN_LONG         32
00104 #define M_SH_ALIGN_FLOAT        32
00105 #define M_SH_ALIGN_DOUBLE       64
00106 #define M_SH_ALIGN_POINTER      32
00107 #define M_SH_ALIGN_UNION        -1      /* depends on the field */
00108 #define M_SH_ALIGN_STRUCT       -1
00109 #define M_SH_ALIGN_BLOCK        -1
00110 #define M_SH_ALIGN_MAX          64
00111 #define M_SH_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX   128
00112 
00113 int
00114 M_sh_type_size (int mtype)
00115 {
00116   switch (mtype)
00117     {
00118     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00119       return M_SH_SIZE_VOID;
00120     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00121       return M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00122     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00123       return M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00124     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00125       return M_SH_SIZE_CHAR;
00126     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00127       return M_SH_SIZE_SHORT;
00128     case M_TYPE_INT:
00129       return M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00130     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00131       return M_SH_SIZE_LONG;
00132     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00133       return M_SH_SIZE_FLOAT;
00134     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00135       return M_SH_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00136     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00137       return M_SH_SIZE_POINTER;
00138     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00139       return M_SH_SIZE_UNION;
00140     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00141       return M_SH_SIZE_STRUCT;
00142     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00143       return M_SH_SIZE_BLOCK;
00144     default:
00145       return -1;
00146     }
00147 }
00148 int
00149 M_sh_type_align (int mtype)
00150 {
00151   switch (mtype)
00152     {
00153     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00154       return M_SH_ALIGN_VOID;
00155     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00156       return M_SH_ALIGN_BIT;
00157     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00158       return M_SH_ALIGN_BIT;
00159     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00160       return M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00161     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00162       return M_SH_ALIGN_SHORT;
00163     case M_TYPE_INT:
00164       return M_SH_ALIGN_INT;
00165     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00166       return M_SH_ALIGN_LONG;
00167     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00168       return M_SH_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00169     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00170       return M_SH_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00171     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00172       return M_SH_ALIGN_POINTER;
00173     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00174       return M_SH_ALIGN_UNION;
00175     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00176       return M_SH_ALIGN_STRUCT;
00177     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00178       return M_SH_ALIGN_BLOCK;
00179     default:
00180       return -1;
00181     }
00182 }
00183 
00184 void
00185 M_sh_char (M_Type type, int unsign)
00186 {
00187   type->type = M_TYPE_CHAR;
00188   type->unsign = unsign;
00189   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00190   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_CHAR;
00191   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_CHAR;
00192 }
00193 
00194 void
00195 M_sh_short (M_Type type, int unsign)
00196 {
00197   type->type = M_TYPE_SHORT;
00198   type->unsign = unsign;
00199   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_SHORT;
00200   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_SHORT;
00201   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_SHORT;
00202 }
00203 
00204 void
00205 M_sh_int (M_Type type, int unsign)
00206 {
00207   type->type = M_TYPE_INT;
00208   type->unsign = unsign;
00209   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_INT;
00210   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00211   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00212 }
00213 
00214 void
00215 M_sh_long (M_Type type, int unsign)
00216 {
00217   type->type = M_TYPE_LONG;
00218   type->unsign = unsign;
00219   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_LONG;
00220   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_LONG;
00221   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_LONG;
00222 }
00223 
00224 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00225 int
00226 M_sh_layout_order (void)
00227 {
00228   return M_BIG_ENDIAN;
00229 }
00230 
00231 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00232 
00233 void
00234 M_set_model_sh (char *model_name)
00235 {
00236   /* make it easy on the user */
00237   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "SH_1") ||
00238       !strcasecmp (model_name, "sh_1") ||
00239       !strcasecmp (model_name, "SH1") || !strcasecmp (model_name, "sh1"))
00240     M_model = M_SH_1;
00241   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "SH_2") ||
00242            !strcasecmp (model_name, "sh_2") ||
00243            !strcasecmp (model_name, "SH2") || !strcasecmp (model_name, "sh2"))
00244     M_model = M_SH_2;
00245   else
00246     M_assert (0, "M_set_model_sh:  Illegal model specified!");
00247 }
